description.narrative: The joint programme aims to complement the Government efforts to protect, respect and fulfil the rights of persons living with disabilities with specific focus on women and war veterans of Nagorno-Karabakh conflict

activity-description.narrative: The joint programme aims to complement the Government efforts to protect, respect the rights of the persons living with disabilities with specific focus on women and war veterans of NK conflict with series of interrelated outputs,

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Unemployment rate disaggregated by sex and age

comment.narrative: 1) Assessment of needs and concerns of women and girls with disabilities and NK war veterans 2) Situation analysis and rapid assessment of the special needs of women with disabilities and war veterans. 3) Gaps in age and sex disaggregated disability data in the national statistical database were identified. Framework and methodology for addressing the existing gaps and improving availability and use of the data by ensuring they are in line with the localised SDG indicators for regular monitoring of the level of employment of persons with disabilities and analytical guidelines on data collection and analysis were developed. 4) Capacity Building for Disability Data Analysis and Statistics Workshop to build the national institutional capacities in producing sex and age disaggregated disability data. 5) Final methodology for preparation of protocols for career guidance and capacity developement of Public Employment Service (PES) 6) Private and public sector engagement 7) Infrastructure Improvement activity has been launched in Masalli, Salyan and Baku (Inclusivity Art School). 8) Entrepreneurship and business plan development training program 9) Total 142 persons will be supported to start entrepreneurship activity. Creation of Virtual Skills Development and Training Lab (V-Lab) for women with disabilities and war veterans to support access to knowledge, information and employment through ICT 10 Inclusivity Art School continues its operations 11) Online sale exhibition of Inclusivity Art School 12) Resource Package on Disability Issues 13) Awareness raising campaigns in Baku, Masalli and Salyan. 14) Promoting participation of persons with disabilities through media

1) 1312 PWD’s and NK war veterans visited and 950 interviewed in Salyan and Masalli regions. Started in 2019 and finalised in 2020. 2) Ongoing. Carried out by international experts Dr. Islay McTaggart and Dr. Morgon Banks. SRC (Social Research Center supports conducting 40 interviews). To be finalised end-February 2021. 3) Framework and methodology will be finalised end-January 2021. 4) Was held on 16-18 December 2020 for the key stakeholders (MLSPP, SSC, SCWFCA and CSOs) 5) Was developed by international expert Oksana Volgina. 6) Consultant is hired. Assessment of local labor market for employment opportunities: a survey was distributed to more than 7) 50 employers and was completed by a total of 17 companies. 8)Existing infrastructure has been evaluated and the recommendations on improvements were provided for the places commonly visited by PWD’s. These recommendations that include sketches, drawings, BOQ and estimates will be used for contracting a local construction company to implement these improvements at both regions and Inclusivity Art School to be located at a brand-new DOST agency of MLSPP in 2021. 9) Executed in both Masalli and Salyan both live (1 round) and online (8 in each region) during coronavirus pandemic, total 18 rounds. 130 participants from both regions and 12 V-Lab platform participants have finalized business plans and awarded with the certificates. Out of 130 participants, 38 were women and 27 men in Salyan and 47 women and 18 men in Masalli. V-Lab platform participants were 11 women (4 from Salyan, 2 from Masalli and 5 from Baku) and 1 men from Baku. All of them been evaluated as positive for financing by the International Bank of Azerbaija. The business plans were evaluated by the evaluation committee in February-August. 10) 61 persons received necessary equipment and supplies to initiate new businesses or develop existing ones. Out of those who received equipment and supplies 28 persons are from Masalli (22 women and 6 men) and 33 persons are from Salyan (19 women and 14 men respectively). Done. The V-lab is located at www.vlaboratory.sosial.gov.az website of the MLSPP 11) Total 66 sessions have been conducted, out of which were held online. The students have been provided with necessary supplies to continue learning at home. The school will move to a new location at DOST Agency of MLSPP in 2021. Presently negotiations for purchase of universal design furniture is being held with local suppliers. 12) Was organized on 3 December 2020 - International Disability Day via zoom to exhibit and sell items produced by the teachers and students. 13) Printed in July 2020. 14) - 2 NGOs run and 285 persons with disabilities and war veterans took an active part in 8 live trainings and campaigns to eliminate disability stigma. - 882 persons participated in online sessions on YouTube, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter and 3,251 persons watched videos. - 6 video success stories and 3 animated films produced to promote rights of persons with disabilities and the veterans.

1) Rapid assessment with 350 respondents in Salyan and 733 respondents in Masalli to be conducted to identify the needs and problems (by the project team) 2) The database for screening applications of the applicants for entrepreneurship activities to be developed 3) Visit of the engineer to Masalli and Salyan to be arranged to establish the needs, to propose standard drawing and to provide pricing for the infrastructural changes 4) Meeting with the applicants (24 in Salyan, 36 in Masalli) for participation in V-Lab activities and business development trainings to be conducted in Masalli and Salyan. Applications have been gathered and will be evaluated via the database for further screening 5) Inclusive art school to be established and equipped in temporary rented location. The director and educators for 3 directions - drawing, knitting and wood carving, have been recruited. 7 students for drawing, 4 students for knitting and 6 students for wood carving have been enrolled to the school. Drawing classes started as of 1.11.19, knitting classes, as of 19.11.19 and wood carving classes will start as of 25.11.19 6) Resource package for awareness raising events to be developed by the consultant 7) 2 local NGO’s (‘Independent Living Center for people with disabilities’ and ‘Center for Social and Psychological studies’) to be recruited to organize awareness raising events in Baku, Salyan and Masalli 8) Publishing company to be recruited for publication and design of promo materials 9) Communication’s person has been selected and currently in the process for the acceptance of the offer 10) V Lab developer to be recruited

1) Conducted 2) Developed 3) Done and sketches prepared for tender 4) Total 14 in Salyan and 15 in Masalli passed the business development training, 2 in Salyan and 5 in Masalli V- Lab – participants 5) Established with 15 students and 4 educators 6) Developed and piloted 7) 2 NGO’s recruited and TOT conducted 8) Recruited for further services 9) The candidate refused the offer 10) Recruited and initiated the process of developing the platform
